Government Delegation of Democratic Congo Concludes Its Visit to�@DPRK 
    Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The government delegation of Democratic Congo headed by Raymond Ramazani Baya, minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, flew back on Nov. 9 after winding up its four-day visit to the DPRK.
 During its stay the delegation visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace and paid homage to President Kim Il Sung.    
 It also visited Mangyongdae where there is the old home of the President, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Grand People's Study House, "Pueblo", the armed spy ship of the U.S. imperialists, and other places.

Ugandan Government Delegation Winds Up DPRK Visit 
    Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The Ugandan government delegation headed by Amama Mbabazi, minister of Defence, flew back on Tuesday after winding up its four-day visit to the DPRK.
 During its stay the delegation visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung and laid a wreath at the Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery on Mt. Taesong.    
 It also visited Mangyongdae where there is the old home of Kim Il Sung, Kim Il Sung Military University, the Mansudae Art Studio and other places.

Government Delegation of Japan Arrives Here 
    Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- A government delegation of Japan led by Mitoji Yabunaka, chief of the Asia and Oceania Bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, arrived here today to participate in the DPRK-Japan inter-governmental working-level contact.
